diagnoses: Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS syndrome)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Autoimmune disorders (e.g., Hashimotos thyroiditis, Lupus, Sjögrens syndrome)

Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Due to the concerning nature of these symptoms, it is inappropriate to provide a list of possible diagnoses. Seeking immediate medical attention is crucial for a proper evaluation and treatment plan.
Allergic reaction (e.g., food, medication, insect sting)
Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) (e.g., Crohns disease, ulcerative colitis)
Heart problems (e.g., heart attack, heart failure)

{Anaphylaxis: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that can cause a wide range of symptoms, including abdominal cramps, hypotension, angioedema, sneezing, and syncope.}, {Mastocytosis: A rare disorder characterized by the accumulation of mast cells (a type of white blood cell) in various tissues, leading to symptoms like abdominal cramps, hypotension, angioedema, sneezing, and syncope when mast cells release inflammatory substances.}, {Hereditary Angioedema (HAE): A genetic condition that causes episodes of swelling in various parts of the body, including the abdomen, face, and airways, often accompanied by abdominal pain, hypotension, and sometimes syncope.}, {Systemic Mastocytosis (SM): A form of mastocytosis that affects multiple organ systems, potentially causing abdominal cramps, hypotension, angioedema, sneezing, and syncope due to mast cell activation.}, {Carcinoid Syndrome: A rare disorder caused by tumors that release hormones, leading to symptoms like abdominal cramps, flushing, diarrhea, and sometimes hypotension and syncope.}, {Food Allergy: An immune system reaction to a specific food, which can cause a range of symptoms, including abdominal cramps, hypotension, angioedema, sneezing, and syncope in severe cases.}, {Drug Allergy: An allergic reaction to a medication, potentially causing symptoms like abdominal cramps, hypotension, angioedema, sneezing, and syncope.}, {Insect Sting Allergy: An allergic reaction to venom from stinging insects, which can trigger symptoms such as abdominal cramps, hypotension, angioedema, sneezing, and syncope.}, {Panic Disorder with Agoraphobia: A mental health condition characterized by panic attacks and anxiety about situations where escape might be difficult, potentially leading to physical symptoms like abdominal cramps, dizziness (which can cause syncope), and hyperventilation (which can cause sneezing).}
Allergic reaction (e.g., allergic conjunctivitis, rhinitis, urticaria)
Stevens-Johnson syndrome/Toxic epidermal necrolysis (rare, but life-threatening)
Vasovagal syncope (although uncommon to have all symptoms present)
Inflammatory bowel disease (diarrhea and flushing may be present)
Panic attack (flushing and diarrhea may be present)
Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohns disease or ulcerative colitis)
Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohns disease or ulcerative colitis)
Nutritional Deficiencies (e.g., Vitamin B12 Deficiency, Folate Deficiency)
